channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: What's the deal with electrolyte drinks — do you need them to stay hydrated?
item.description: Seems like nobody's drinking plain water these days. Electrolyte packets or colorful sports drinks are everywhere. But do you need them?

item.title: Sen. Klobuchar says Congress must 'reassert' itself after weak jobs report
item.description: U.S. Sen. Amy Klobuchar, D-Minn., denounces Trump tariffs and the firing of a senior Labor official, saying Trump needs to "get this under control" or Congress will "be a check on him."

item.title: Will the president's economic policies slow down the economy?
item.description: New and higher tariffs are set to take effect this week, amid signs the president's economic policies are resulting in higher prices and slower economic growth.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Will the president's economic policies slow down the economy?, businesses along the U.S.-Mexico border feel the uncertainty of tariffs negotiations, the U.S. envoy to the Middle East met with Israeli hostages' families over the weekend.

item.title: UK's first woman Astronomer Royal
item.description: Astronomer Professor Michele Dougherty is the first woman in over 350-year history to be appointed the UK's Astronomer Royal. She'll serve as the official adviser to King Charles III on astronomical matters.

item.title: Whatever happened to memorable movie soundtracks?
item.description: Whatever happened to movie soundtracks? They used to generate hit after hit for pop radio. Now, they're few and far between.

item.title: 12 states sue the Trump administration alleging new tariffs are illegal
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Oregon Attorney General Dan Rayfield, who leads a coalition of 12 states in a lawsuit alleging that Trump administration tariffs are illegal.

item.title: Switzerland will face one of the steepest Trump tariffs, at 39%
item.description: President Trump's 39% tariff on goods from Switzerland is among the world's steepest import taxes. For the European nation, the announcement comes at an unwelcome time.

item.title: Texas House Democrats break quorum, leave state to stop GOP redistricting plan
item.description: At least 51 Texas House Democrats left the state Sunday, to break quorum ahead of a vote on a bill that would dramatically redraw Texas' congressional maps.

item.title: A Texas Democratic lawmaker on their efforts to stop Republican redistricting plans
item.description: Texas House Democrats fled the state in an effort to deprive Republicans of a quorum in a vote on a redistricting plan. NPR's Michel Martin talks with Democratic lawmaker Gina Hinojosa.
